comment.$comment: A brief, descriptive explanation of what this interface represents that will be surfaced to consumers of your capability.
comment.title: Comment

array.$comment: This parameter is an `array` of the type specified. If you set this to an object you can pass in extra parameters to automatically validate the input.
array.title: Array

min.$comment: The minimum length of the array

max.$comment: The maximum length of the array

value.$comment: A hardcoded value that your function will pass to the host when this function is called. Mutually exclusive with the `reference` parameter.
value.title: Value

reference.$comment: A reference to another parameter in your capability. This can be used to pass input parameters to the function directly to the host iff `true`. Mutually exclusive with the `value` parameter.
reference.title: Reference

placeholder.$comment: iff 'true', a placeholder with this name will be created in the TeamsJS function that is generated with a default value. *IMPORTANT*: You will need to go and calculate or retrieve the correct value by hand if this is true. Can only be true if `reference: 'true'`
placeholder.title: Reference

stringType.title: String Type

min.$comment: The minimum length of the string

max.$comment: The maximum length of the string

numberType.$comment: This parameter is of type `number`.  If you set this to an object you can pass in extra parameters to automatically validate the input.
numberType.title: Number Type

min.$comment: The minimum value for the number

max.$comment: The maximum value for the number

name.$comment: The name of the enum type, this will be visible to external developers
